author: wmtan
body:
"auto thePtr = std::make_shared<MyClass>(...)" is preferred to "shared_ptr thePtr(new MyClass(...)) " because it saves a memory allocation. It allocates the shared_ptr and the pointee in the same allocation.
This PR changes the very few places in core software that did it the suboptimal way.
Note: make_shared requires that the pointee class has a public constructor. There were two cases where the pointee class had a private constructor, so I did not change those cases.
title: Use make_shared in core software
